stuff.ques: Mass spectrometers are used to determine which of the following?
stuff.answer: Relative mass of atoms. Explanation: Mass spectrometers are used to determine the relative mass of atoms and molecules. Aston made the instrument more accurate.
Aston Explanation: J.J Thompson introduced mass spectrometers. Aston modified the instrument to make it more accurate.

stuff.ques: In mass spectrometer, the sample that has to be analysed is bombarded with which of the following?
stuff.answer: Electrons Explanation: In mass spectrometer, the sample which is to be analysed is bombarded with electrons. As a result, ions are produced.

stuff.ques: Mass spectrometer separates ions on the basis of which of the following?
stuff.answer: Mass to Charge ratio Explanation: Mass spectrometer separates ions on the basis of mass to charge ratio. Most of the ions are singly charged. Hence, the mass to charge ratio is equal to the mass.

stuff.ques: In mass spectrometer, the ions are sorted out in which of the following ways?
stuff.choice1: By accelerating them through electric field
stuff.choice2: By accelerating them through magnetic field
stuff.choice3: By accelerating them through electric and magnetic field
stuff.answer: By accelerating them through electric and magnetic field. Explanation: In mass spectrometer, the ions are sorted out by accelerating them through electric and magnetic field. A record of number of different kinds of ions is called mass spectrum.

stuff.ques: No two molecules will be fragmented and ionized in exactly the same manner.
stuff.answer: True Explanation: No two molecules will be fragmented and ionized in exactly the same manner. This is how different molecules are identified in a complex mixture.

stuff.ques: The procedure for mass spectroscopy starts with which of the following processes?
stuff.choice1: The sample is bombarded by electron beam
stuff.choice2: The ions are separated by passing them into electric and magnetic field
stuff.choice3: The sample is converted into gaseous state
stuff.answer: The sample is converted into gaseous state Explanation: The procedure for mass spectroscopy starts with converting the sample into gaseous state. This is done by chemical processes.

stuff.ques: In mass spectrometer, the ion currents are measured using which of the following?
stuff.answer: Electrometer tube. Explanation: The ion currents are measured using sensitive electrometer tube. The ions reaching the collecting plate are measured.

stuff.ques: Which of the following ions pass through the slit and reach the collecting plate?
stuff.answer: Positive ions of specific mass Explanation: Positive ions of specific mass pass through the slit and reach the collecting plate. These ions are measured.

stuff.ques: Which of the following statements is not true about mass spectrometry?
stuff.choice1: Impurities of masses different from the one being analysed interferes with the result
stuff.choice3: It is suitable for data storage
stuff.answer: Impurities of masses different from the one being analysed interferes with the result. Explanation: Impurities of masses different from the one being analysed does not interfere with the result in mass spectroscopy. This is a major advantage of this technique.
